sections.title: Syntax
sections.text_content: drawbox (x1, y1, x2, y2, Color : int)

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The drawbox procedure is used to draw a box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the specified Color.
sections.text_content: The drawbox procedure is used to draw a box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the specified Color.
sections.mdown_content:
The **drawbox** procedure is used to draw a box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (_x1_, _y1_) to (_x2_, _y2_) using the specified _Color_.



![Doc Image](drawbox01.gif)

sections.title: Example
sections.raw_content: This program draws a large box, reaching to each corner of the screen using color number 1. The maxx and maxy functions are used to determine the maximum x and y values on the screen. The point (0,0) is the left bottom of the screen and (maxx, maxy) is the right top.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The meaning of the Color number depends on the current palette. See the palette statement.

The screen should be in a "graphics" mode. See the setscreen procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, it will automatically be set to "graphics" mode.
